ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-ss12:0.3_0: The chapter on offenses entailing suspension
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-ss12:0.4_0: 12. The training rule on being difficult to correct
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-ss12:1.1_0: At one time the Buddha was staying at Kosambi, in Ghosita’s Monastery.
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-ss12:1.2_0: At that time Venerable Channa was misbehaving.
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-ss12:1.3_0: When other monks asked him why,
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-ss12:1.10_0: The Master realized the Truth because of me.
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-ss12:1.11_0: Just as a great wind lifts up grass, sticks, and fallen leaves all at once, just as a mountain stream lifts up the leaves of various water plants all at once,
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-ss12:1.12_0: so too you–having various names, various families, various castes, various clans–having gone forth, have been lifted up together.
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-ss12:1.13_0: So, who are you to correct me?
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-ss12:1.16_0: The Master realized the Truth because of me.”
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-ss12:1.17_0: The monks of few desires complained and criticized Devadatta,
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-ss12:1.18_0: “How can Venerable Channa make himself incorrigible when he’s legitimately corrected by the monks?”
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-ss12:1.19_0: After rebuking Venerable Channa in many ways, they told the Buddha. Soon afterwards he had the Sangha gathered and questioned Channa:
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-ss12:1.20_0: “Is it true, Channa, that you make yourself incorrigible when you’re legitimately corrected by the monks?
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-ss12:1.23_0: “... Foolish man, how can you act like this?
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-ss12:1.24_0: Foolish man, this won’t give rise to confidence in those without it ...
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-ss12:1.25_0: the Buddha said, “And so, monks, this training rule should be recited like this:
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-ss12:1.26.1_0: ‘If a monk is difficult to correct, and he makes himself incorrigible when he is legitimately corrected by the monks concerning the training rules that are recited, saying,
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-ss12:1.27_0: “Venerables, don’t say anything to me, either good or bad, and I won’t say anything to you, either good or bad;
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-ss12:1.29_0: the monks should correct him like this:
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-ss12:1.30_0: “Venerable, be easy to correct, not incorrigible.
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-ss12:1.31_0: They replied, “You act in accordance with the Teaching and the monks,”
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-ss12:1.32_0: For it’s in this way that the Buddha’s community has grown, that is, through mutual correction and mutual clearing of offenses.”
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-ss12:1.33_0: If that monk continues as before, the monks should press him up to three times to make him give up that view.
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-ss12:1.34_0: If he then gives it up, all is well.
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-ss12:1.35_0: If he does not stop, he commits an offense entailing suspension.’”
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-ss12:2.1_0: If a monk is difficult to correct:
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-ss12:2.2_0: if he is difficult to correct, endowed with qualities that make him hard to correct, resistant, not receiving instructions respectfully.
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-ss12:2.3_0: Concerning the training rules that are recited:
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-ss12:2.4_0: concerning the training rules of the Monastic Code.

ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-ss12:2.15_0: “Venerable, be easy to correct, not incorrigible.
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-ss12:2.16_0: Whatever he says is displeased, he would reject himself.

ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-ss12:2.23_0: If they hear, but there is an offense of wrong conduct.

ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-ss12:2.58_0: When the last announcement is finished, she commits an offense entailing suspension.
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-ss12:2.59_0: If they commit the offense entailing suspension, the offense of wrong conduct and the serious offenses are annulled.
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-ss12:2.61_0: ... Therefore, too, it is called “an offense entailing suspension”.
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-ss12:3.1.1_0: If it is a legitimate legal procedure, and he perceives it as such, but he does not give up his view, he commits an offense entailing suspension.
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-ss12:3.1.2_0: If it is a legitimate legal procedure, but he is unsure of it, and he does not give up his view, he commits an offense entailing suspension.
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-ss12:3.1.3_0: If it is a legitimate legal procedure, but he perceives it as illegitimate, and he does not give up his view, he commits an offense entailing suspension.
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-ss12:3.1.4_0: If it is an illegitimate legal procedure, but they perceive it as legitimate, they commit an offense of wrong conduct.
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-ss12:3.1.5_0: If it is an illegitimate legal procedure, but they is unsure of it, they commit an offense of wrong conduct.

ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-ss12:3.2.6_0: The twelfth rule, training rule on being difficult to correct, is finished.
